009package imagingbook.lib.util.resource;
010
011import java.io.File;
012import java.io.IOException;
013import java.io.InputStream;
014import java.net.URI;
015import java.net.URISyntaxException;
016import java.net.URL;
017import java.nio.file.FileSystem;
018import java.nio.file.FileSystemNotFoundException;
019import java.nio.file.FileSystems;
020import java.nio.file.Files;
021import java.nio.file.Path;
022import java.nio.file.Paths;
023import java.util.ArrayList;
024import java.util.Collections;
025import java.util.Iterator;
026import java.util.List;
027import java.util.stream.Stream;
028
029import ij.ImagePlus;
030import ij.io.Opener;
031import imagingbook.lib.util.FileUtils;
032
033
034/**
035 * This class defines static methods for accessing resources.
036 * What makes things somewhat complex is the requirement that
037 * we want to retrieve resources located in the file system or
038 * contained inside a JAR file.
039 * <br>
040 * A typical URI for a JAR-embedded file:
041 * "jar:file:/C:/PROJEC~2/parent/IM1D84~1/ImageJ/jars/jarWithResources.jar!/jarWithResouces/resources/clown.jpg"
042 * <br>
043 * This class has been deprecated - use {@link ResourceLocation} instead!
044 *
045 * @author W. Burger
046 * @version 2016/06/04
047 * @deprecated
048 */
049public class ResourceUtils {
050        
051        /**
052         * Determines if the specified class was loaded from
053         * a JAR file or a .class file in the file system.
054         * 
055         * @param clazz the class
056         * @return true if contained in a JAR file, false otherwise
057         */
058        public static boolean isInsideJar(Class<?> clazz) {
059                URL url = clazz.getProtectionDomain().getCodeSource().getLocation();
060                String path = url.getPath();
061                File file = new File(path);
062                return file.isFile();
063        }
064        
065        /**
066         * Finds the URI for a resource relative to a specified class.
067         * The resource may be located in the file system or
068         * inside a JAR file.
069         * 
070         * @param clazz the anchor class
071         * @param relPath the resource path relative to the anchor class
072         * @return the URI or {@code null} if the resource was not found
073         */
074        public static URI getResourceUri(Class<?> clazz, String  relPath) {
075                URI uri = null;
076                if (isInsideJar(clazz)) {
077                        String classPath = clazz.getProtectionDomain().getCodeSource().getLocation().getFile();
078                        //String packagePath = clazz.getPackage().getName().replace('.', File.separatorChar);
079                        String packagePath = clazz.getPackage().getName().replace('.', '/');
080                        String compPath = "jar:file:" + classPath + "!/" + packagePath + "/" + relPath;
081                        try {
082                                uri = new URI(compPath);
083                        } catch (URISyntaxException e) {
084                                // throw new RuntimeException("getResourceURI: " + e.toString());
085                        }       
086                }
087                else {  // regular file path
088                        try {
089                                uri = clazz.getResource(relPath).toURI();
090                        } catch (Exception e) {
091                                //do nothing, just return null - was: throw new RuntimeException("getResourceURI: " + e.toString());
092                        }
093                }
094                return uri;
095        }
096        
097        /**
098         * Find the path to a resource relative to the location of class c.
099         * Example: Assume class C was loaded from file someLocation/C.class
100         * and there is a subfolder someLocation/resources/ that contains 
101         * an image 'lenna.jpg'. Then the complete path to this image
102         * is obtained by 
103         * <pre>
104         * Path path = getResourcePath(C.class, "resources/lenna.jpg");
105         * </pre>
106         * 2016-06-03: modified to return proper path to resource inside 
107         * a JAR file.
108         * 
109         * @param clazz anchor class 
110         * @param relPath the path of the resource to be found (relative to the location of the anchor class)
111         * @return the path to the specified resource
112         */
113        public static Path getResourcePath(Class<?> clazz, String relPath) {
114                URI uri = getResourceUri(clazz, relPath);
115                if (uri != null) {
116                        return uriToPath(uri);
117                }
118                else {
119                        return null;
120                }
121        }
122        
123        /**
124         * Converts an URI to a Path for locations that are either
125         * in the file system or inside a JAR file.
126         * 
127         * @param uri the specified location
128         * @return the associated path
129         */
130        public static Path uriToPath(URI uri) {
131                Path path = null;
132                String scheme = uri.getScheme();
133                switch (scheme) {
134                case "jar":     {       // resource inside JAR file
135                        FileSystem fs = null;
136                        try { // check if this FileSystem already exists 
137                                fs = FileSystems.getFileSystem(uri);
138                        } catch (FileSystemNotFoundException e) {
139                                // that's OK to happen, the file system is not created automatically
140                        }
141                        
142                        if (fs == null) {       // must not create the file system twice
143                                try {
144                                        fs = FileSystems.newFileSystem(uri, Collections.<String, Object>emptyMap());
145                                } catch (IOException e) {
146                                        throw new RuntimeException("uriToPath: " + e.toString());
147                                }
148                        }
149                        
150                        String ssp = uri.getSchemeSpecificPart();
151                        int startIdx = ssp.lastIndexOf('!');
152                        String inJarPath = ssp.substring(startIdx + 1);  // in-Jar path (after the last '!')
153                        path = fs.getPath(inJarPath);
154                        break;
155                }
156                case "file": {  // resource in ordinary file system
157                        path = Paths.get(uri);
158                        break;
159                }
160                default:
161                        throw new IllegalArgumentException("Cannot handle this URI type: " + scheme);
162                }
163                return path;
164        }
165        
166        public static Path[] getResourcePaths(URI uri) {
167                return getResourcePaths(uriToPath(uri));
168        }
169        
170        
171        /**
172         * Method to obtain the paths to all files in a directory specified
173         * by a path. This should work in an ordinary file system
174         * as well as a (possibly nested) JAR file.
175         * 
176         * @param path path to a directory (may be contained in a JAR file) 
177         * @return a sequence of paths or {@code null} if the specified path 
178         * is not a directory
179         */
180        public static Path[] getResourcePaths(Path path) {
181                // with help from http://stackoverflow.com/questions/1429172/how-do-i-list-the-files-inside-a-jar-file, #10
182                if (!Files.isDirectory(path)) {
183                        throw new IllegalArgumentException("path is not a directory: " + path.toString());
184                }
185                
186                List<Path> pathList = new ArrayList<Path>();
187                Stream<Path> walk = null;
188                try {
189                        walk = Files.walk(path, 1);
190                } catch (IOException e) {
191                        e.printStackTrace();
192                }
193
194                for (Iterator<Path> it = walk.iterator(); it.hasNext();){
195                        Path p = it.next();
196                        if (Files.isRegularFile(p) && Files.isReadable(p)) {
197                                pathList.add(p);
198                        }
199                }
200                walk.close();
201                return pathList.toArray(new Path[0]);
202        }
203        
204        /**
205         * Use this method to obtain the paths to all files in a directory located
206         * relative to the specified class. This should work in an ordinary file system
207         * as well as a (possibly nested) JAR file.
208         * 
209         * @param clazz class whose source location specifies the root 
210         * @param relPath path relative to the root
211         * @return a sequence of paths or {@code null} if the specified path is not a directory
212         */
213        public static Path[] getResourcePaths(Class<?> clazz, String relPath) {
214                return getResourcePaths(getResourceUri(clazz, relPath));
215        }
216        
217        
218        /**
219         * Opens an image from the specified resource. 
220         * If the resource is contained inside a JAR file, it is first
221         * extracted to a temporary file and subsequently opened
222         * with ImageJ's {@code Opener} class. 
223         * 
224         * @param clazz the anchor class
225         * @param resDir the directory relative to the anchor class
226         * @param resName the (file) name of the image resource
227         * @return the opened image or {@code null} if not successful.
228         */
229        public static ImagePlus openImageFromResource(Class<?> clazz, String resDir, String resName) {
230                URI uri = getResourceUri(clazz, resDir + resName);
231                if (uri == null) {
232                        //IJ.error("resource not found: " + clazz.getName() + " | " + resDir  + " | " + resName);
233                        return null;
234                }
235                
236                ImagePlus im = null;
237                
238                String scheme = uri.getScheme();
239                switch (scheme) {
240                case "file": {  // resource in ordinary file system
241                        Path path = Paths.get(uri);
242                        im = new Opener().openImage(path.toString());
243                        break;
244                }
245                case "jar": { // resource inside JAR
246                        // create a temporary file:
247                        String ext = FileUtils.getFileExtension(resName);
248                        File tmpFile = null;
249                        try {
250                                tmpFile = File.createTempFile("img", "." + ext);
251                                tmpFile.deleteOnExit();
252                        } 
253                        catch (IOException e) {
254                                throw new RuntimeException("Could not create temporary file");
255                        }
256                                                
257                        String relPath = resDir + resName;
258                        InputStream inStrm = clazz.getResourceAsStream(relPath);
259                        
260                        try {
261                                FileUtils.copyToFile(inStrm, tmpFile);
262                        } catch (IOException e) {
263                                throw new RuntimeException("Could not copy stream to temporary file");
264                        }
265                        
266                        im = new Opener().openImage(tmpFile.getPath());
267                        if (im != null) {
268                                im.setTitle(resName);
269                        }
270                        tmpFile.delete();
271                        break;
272                }
273                default:
274                        throw new IllegalArgumentException("Cannot handle this resource type: " + scheme);
275                }
276                return im;
277        }
278        
279
